website_summaries.verdict: This jacket is a flattering modification of the classic trench coat.
pros: Doesn’t hang heavy on the body
Includes a generous hood to protect your head from rain
Can adjust the cuffs to your wrist size
Most women find the belt around the waist flattering
Packs well into a bag because of its thinness
cons: Fabric isn’t breathable for humid climates

customer_reviews.title: Cute light jacket
customer_reviews.text: I am 4'11" 100lbs. I ordered an extra small. It is a little big in me but not terribly bad. I can probably fit a sweater or hoodie underneath comfortably. The zipper is a little finicky. It takes me a bit of time to zip up. The color looks grey in the photo but is more of a olive green color. I dont hate it, I just have too many green jackets already. I like the waste tie. It gives the jacket just the right feminine touch. I bought this jacket for a trip coming up. I'm able to roll this jacket into it's hood for easy storage in my suit case.
customer_reviews.author: Gao

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful rain jacket!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rain jacket for a river cruise in Europe during Spring, which is a notoriously rainy season. This jacket was PERFECT!!! I could not be happier with my purchase! I am 5’8” and 150 pounds and I bought a size large so that I could layer underneath without feeling constricted. I could have gone for a medium, but I’m happy with the large because I can wear it over sweaters in colder temperatures or I can tie it tighter when not using heavier layers. I love the color because it helped me stand out in crowded tourist areas so my husband could see me easily. The price can’t be beat! Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.author: A.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof at all.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Columbia Women's Pardon My Trench Rain Jacket, Black, X-Large for just over two months and I'm incredibly disappointed with the quality and functionality of the item, especially by Columbia standards. - The outer shell is of porous material - not waterproof at all. The zipper is flimsy and often gets stuck. The inner, white lining is already starting to peel and fray SIGNIFICANTLY after minimal wear. I wrote to Columbia for a replacement or refund and they said I need to take it up at point of purchase. I am past by Prime return window so taking this up with Amazon now. Such an annoying hassle all around. I just wanted a rain coat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Szapiro

customer_reviews.title: Really nice rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest rain jacket I've seen so far that is both functional and stylish. I usually wear a small but ended up going with the extra small. I wish the inside of the jacket wasn't white. I find that part unattractive but I'm happy enough with it to keep it and still love it. Haven't had a chance to get rained on yet so we'll see how waterproof it is but Columbia makes good products and I'm not concerned about that. I do wish the belt was removable as I don't always use it but I see why they would have it stitched in.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Go one size larger
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning it. Once I tried it on it was tight underneath the bust. The bust & the waist fit fine. As weird as it sounds it was in between the two that was tight. I wear a 34 double-D and the bust was okay. I am 5'2 and weigh a 145 pounds. A medium was snug on me. I would have ordered a large. Zipper was also a major pain in the butt to operate. It was like a double zipper but the bottom half of the zipper doesn't do anything but sit there and hold the top zipper. Was pretty disappointed in this jacket. It just fit weird all together.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Not as rainproof as I'd hoped. A bit clumsy to secure.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is pretty good at keeping out the cold. Unfortunately the same can't be said for keeping out the rain. My arms get wet every time I walk in the rain. Thankfully my core stays dry, but it's rather uncomfortable to feel the fabric sticking to my arms. I took off another star because the zipper is so difficult to get going. Maybe I got a faulty one, but you really need to make sure you have time to fiddle with the zipper to hook it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Gicky

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this raincoat for a trip to Rome in the rainy season and ended up wearing it most days of the trip. The length helps keep the water off of your legs (which was HUGE since we did a lot of walking), and it's light enough that you can wear layers underneath and not feel stuffy. I would say that it's not made for standing in constant rain for 4-5 hours though. It will eventually leak through and your clothes will get wet. If you just need it to keep you dry going from place to place then it's perfect. It folds up very easily and dries quick so it's perfect for packing.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie P

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket but somewhat small
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket but somewhat small. I'm 5"4, 150lbs, & on the slim side. However I'm a bit healthier in the hip and butt area. That's where the jacket is a bit snug. Other than that it fits fine. I ordered a medium, didn't return. I think the large would have been to big overall.
customer_reviews.author: T Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, well made and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I was caught in the rain both in South Carolina and the Pacific Northwest and stayed completely dry. I’m 5’9” and 150 pounds and the large fits nicely. It’s roomy enough to wear a fleece under if it’s cold. The fabric is like a heavy windbreaker. The up/down zipper is sturdy and very handy for getting into pockets under the jacket. The hood is just right and designed to cover the brim of a baseball cap. The red is very bright but not fluorescent. I only wish the belt was lower, as it sits above my waist, and it’s not removable, so I tied it behind my back. Unlined, so inside doesn’t look very stylish, but it is very light.
customer_reviews.author: cricket

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Prime saves the day again!
customer_reviews.text: I float between a medium and a large; purchased a large in this coat; fits wonderful, with plenty of room for a bulky sweater underneath, but the sleeves are a bit too long. No big deal. This jacket definitely saved me. I realized 3 days before my trip to Ireland that my "summer" rain jacket would have zero room to add layers for warmth. It worked beautifully and it looked much better than wearing a poncho! The hood is pretty deep, with a large visor--I could put it over my big messy bun with no problems. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Caitie O

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but retains heat
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a great raincoat, it served me well just two days after arriving. However, the fabric was not as polished as I was expecting based off the image. The fabric does not seem to breathe and had me sweating a bit in 58* F rainy weather. I have a raincoat that is suited for cold weather so I had hoped this one would be good for temperatures 60+, but I'm concerned it retains heat too much. We will see! The item does run a bit small, so if you are between sizes, go up! 5'7, 140 lbs, medium was the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I love the length
customer_reviews.text: This is my second jacket of this style and brand. I love the length, the way it looks on me (tailored and slimming) and, the hood. It does protect from the rain. It fits true to size. Two things that aren’t ideal; the first one I bought developed a hole in the pocket after minimal use. Also, both jackets take a bit of finesse to get the zipper in the correct position to zip up. So minus one star for those two problems. Otherwise, it’s a good looking and functional jacket.
customer_reviews.author: tetar1

customer_reviews.title: COLUMBIA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rain coat at the last minute. There was a storm coming and my North Face all weather jacket is just a little too warm for summer/fall rain so I wanted something lighter. My first choice was a trench coat but the one I wanted became unavailable. I kept searching and found this gem. It looked perfect and was just what I needed. Besides my all weather coat, I didn't have anything else just for rain and I have owned a Columbia rain jacket previously so I trusted them to be just what I needed and it fulfilled its purpose. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

customer_reviews.title: This item is not the Columbia I know..
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this item bc Columbia is a good brand, in my opinion. I thought I would have better luck with this brand than going with a more generic one. Well, no. This rain jacket is odd. The hood has a drawstring in it that is poorly constructed. To make it LOOK LIKE a hood, the drawstring must be pulled tight. It looks like a baseball cap on your head bc it has an actual brim! The "fabric" is a stiff; it feels like laminated paper! I'd skip this if I were you..
customer_reviews.author: elleemann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality jacket
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely in love with this jacket!! It is extremely versatile! I’m 5’4”, 170lbs and carry most of my weight in my arms. I bought a Large and still had room to layer with a sweater and two long-sleeve shirts. Kept me completely dry on my trip to London. And when layered also keeps you warm. And it’s light enough that you can wear in Florida (home) and not be too hot. Doesn’t take up any space in the luggage. Plus it’s still stylish with the belt to accentuate the waist, has buttons and a zipper and a hood. Lastly, that jacket fell below butt so won’t get wet in the rain. Highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kamilah B.

customer_reviews.title: The fit is great - the belt enhances a feminine silhouette
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great - the belt enhances a feminine silhouette. What I don't like though is that when you wear the jacket with the upper portion unzipped, the inside of the jacket is white and looks rather cheap because of this. It would have been much more of a classy look if at least the top portion of the inside were also black. Haven't decided if I'm keeping it or not because of this. But otherwise, it's super light weight, a great length, and a great fit. The hood is a little smaller than I would have liked too, but does adjust and has a visor-like design. The cuffs adjust as well.
customer_reviews.author: Leelee

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you from getting soaked!
customer_reviews.text: I live in South Florida and afternoon thunderstorms are a way of life hence, my purchase of this jacket. This jacket is true to size, comfortable, and most importantly keeps the rain out. I like that it is longer so my clothes don't get soaked. I bought it just for walking the dog, but ended up using it everywhere. I keep it in my car just in case. There are literally no down sides to this jacket. I would definitely recommend it if you are on the fence about buying it.
customer_reviews.author: MechInspector

customer_reviews.title: Loved my first rain jacket but this one disappoints
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the exact same jacket three years ago and love it. Fits well, is comfortable and so I Decided to buy the same jacket in another color. Very disappointed. My error was not trying it on before I removed the price tags and tossed them. The fabric is rough and it runs very small. Either the company changed the manufacturer or they are cutting costs. Not worth the money. I’ll just continue wearing my old jacket.
customer_reviews.author: TapperMargie

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, tight around hip/waist, poofs up in middle
customer_reviews.text: I love the Columbia brand, but this trench coat was a disappointment and I had to return it. I ordered a medium and the arms were perfect length, but the coat is way too tight around the hip/waist area so when zipped up, it poofs up in the stomach area. I tried on a large and of course that was too big: the arms were too long and I just looked poofy everywhere, lol. I think the coat runs small and would make a great coat for someone with a slim/slender build.
customer_reviews.author: jmrvcl

customer_reviews.title: This is the best jacket! Purchased for trip to Norway
customer_reviews.text: This is the best jacket! Purchased for trip to Norway. I listened to the reviews and purchased a Large. I was hesitant because I wear an 8/10 and have other Columbia jackets in a medium. It appears to have a loose fit below the waste, but unless you are very straight in the hip, I'd go a size up. Very flattering! I love that the arms are large enough so that I can wear a fleece jacket underneath! I think I'll buy another :) For sizing: 5'7" about 160
customer_reviews.author: dke64

customer_reviews.title: Very cute. But not breathable.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. Love the trenchy style. The "Red/Camellia" color is like Raspberry red and very nice. Goes perfectly with skinny jeans. Nice lightweight and makes a good windbreaker or raincoat. Only negative is...it is not breathable. Some reviewer says it is but I do not believe it is. It has a mesh lining in the back that makes a "ventilation" but material itself is an old-fashion non-breathable nylon. I felt very sticky when I was perspiring (reminded me of an yellow vinyl raincoat when I was growing up). Overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight waterproof jacket
customer_reviews.text: Pic of the medium unzipped ( I have on a sweat shirt, jean jacket, and the jacket over the top), pic of it zipped showing it isn’t bulging, and a pic of it tied. I don’t love the look of it tied but it works well. Bought for trip to AU during a rainy week. Worked out great. No umbrella needed. The hood covered my face when my hair was down and did an ok job with a top knot bun. I’m 5’7, 142lbs and the medium was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Justpeachy85

customer_reviews.title: Pardon My Trench perfect for Paris!
customer_reviews.text: I recently traveled to Paris, France and bought this coat for the trip. I am a big fan of Columbia rain coats and wanted something a little more polished than my usual sports-wear look because, Paris. This coat was perfect! It looked good, performed well on a few rainy November days and accommodated multiple layers underneath for the chilly days! I brought an extra jacket but I only wore this one! The one draw back was when walking around museums, if I didn't take off my coat, it got a little clammy inside. The breathability is not great. That was a minor problem and I just learned to take it off or coat check it!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, stylish, hoping it will be rainproof when I finally wear it.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket Is a nice length. The fit is true to size (medium for me) I am 5’8” and 140lbs. I haven’t given it the “rain test” yet. I did try a layer or two underneath it to make sure it would still fit comfortably when it was done up and it does. The color is a bit greener than I expected, I thought it would be a tad greyer-green. It is a nice neutral color though. Arm length is longish, and the hood fits well with a little extra so rain won’t get on your face. Love the fact that the belt is an integral part of the jacket so don’t have to worry about losing it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamu

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Great waterproof jacket! Purchased this jacket for my teenage daughter for a vacation to a potentially rainy location. Yep, it rained and she was dry and happy. Good sized hood and she liked the sash style belt. She also liked the snap front placket and zipper. Sometimes she would just snap a couple snaps to keep the jacket closed versus using the zipper. Water just beaded up and rolled off her jacket, without the fabric feeling too stiff. Overall, a great jacket. I purchased a different brand for myself and found out the hard way that it was not waterproof. I wish I had the Columbia. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: High waisted
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would be a very cute coat for someone who is 5’4. Am 5’8 and a size 12-14 and should have ordered XL for girth. Large fit ok, but no room for layers and a little snug. I won’t be ordering the larger size though because the jacket is very short waisted with the belt hitting just barely below bra line. I need a different style with my height. Otherwise no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: RareReviews1234

customer_reviews.title: Pretty coat, zipper issues had me sending it back
customer_reviews.text: The coat is a light weight fabric and is noted to be waterproof. The colour is very pretty. The style didn't fit me as I had hoped. It was not as flowing from the waist down. The biggest reason I returned the coat was the zipper. It didn't open on either direction. I spent over an hour trying to figure this out. No go. And to try it on, it had to go over my head. Nope, not in a down pour.
customer_reviews.author: CatCough

customer_reviews.title: Nice raincoat at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the 1st one so much, I bought another. I have it in black and light gray. I'm 5'3, 132 lbs and the medium fits perfectly. I love the cut, style and the length of this jacket. Especially for my height, if I'm looking at a longer length it's usually too long. It's lightly lined and lightweight. Adjustable sleeves and zippered pockets. Excellent quality for a good price. I would highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like the lining . Cut feels tighter .
customer_reviews.text: Sent this back unfortunately! Appeared to be a very fashionable jacket. What was a problem for me was the tight cut and an interior that was almost latex like and these types of linings create unneeded sweating. I really don't like to feel that moisture inside a raincoat. Columbia should revise the lining. Maybe add another taffeta or other layer? Preventing the sweat promoting layer from having contact directly to the skin.
customer_reviews.author: joy777

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty basic rain coat
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty basic rain coat. It's thin material and there isn't any lining. I'm tall and thin so ordering anything long-sleeved online can be a bit of a gamble. This jacket seems a little big for a medium and I could've ordered a small but the sleeves may have been a bit too short. Since the jacket is not lined the extra room will be good to wear a sweatshirt or fleece underneath if it's cold and rainy. The length is perfect for this type of jacket. The quality is what I would expect of a Columbia jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great form fitting rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is a really attractive and well made jacket. The flint grey is more of a clay color, which I like. I usually wear M size tops but sized up to a L as recommended. It fits, but I am surprised at how little room there is for layering. It is clearly meant to be form fitting, so if you want something a little more roomy, I'd recommend sizing up by 2 sizes, especially if you are between sizes. Update: I tested out the waterproof aspect of this coat, having to walk across town in a steady rain. I stayed dry everywhere covered by the coat.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected great find.
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this coat. It's just exactly what I've been looking for the last 2 years. Other than the great style, which can go from running the kids around town to a night out, the weight is perfect for me, light so I can layer. The Columbia designers did a good job on this one, the zipper is not exposed when the coat is belted, so it has class without the sporty bling that calls for another coat for evening. It fits me perfectly at 5 ft 7 in and 110 lbs., plenty loose but not sloppy. A real find in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Utilitarian and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a rain jacket that had a tie or drawstring around the waist, and I think this one is pretty much perfect! I live in the rainy Pacific Northwest and I've worn it out quite a bit and it keeps me nice and dry. I love that it has snaps and zippers and that the sleeves can be made smaller with different snaps. The hood also stays in place nightly with a top snap. I sized up so I could easily wear a sweater or warm jacket underneath, and it fits nicely that way, so I would say it runs true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this even after reading reviews about trouble with the zipper. The jacket is well-made, though seemed oddly-sized, but I find that with most clothes now. The jacket has a nice cut, but I wanted it longer; in the end it was the zipper that got it sent back. Too hard to work - took too much time/trouble to get it started, to use the bottom-up zipper, etc. That, and the belt was just designed poorly - after tying it the ends stuck right out straight and had to be wound around and tucked. Too much to fuss over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this jacket. Makes me wish it was rainy everyday, so i have an excuse to wear it more often. Love that it has both zipper and buttons AND a belt to tie around waist so you can choose how you want to wear it. The side pockets have zippers, so you won't have to worry about losing things that may fall out. I'm thinking of ordering another one in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: perl lindayag

customer_reviews.title: Top rain jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Really super rain jacket - looks good, fits well. I am an expert on rain wear because I live on the Oregon coast, and we have gotten soaked this winter! Because I wear layers, I ordered one size up, just to be sure I had a comfortable fit. I probably could have gone with my normal size.
customer_reviews.author: beachbum61

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Rain Coat
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Columbia rain jackets for over 10 years. The "Pardon My Trench" coat is waterproof. It's kept me dry in pouring rain. I am 5'4" and 200 pounds. I'm hourglass shaped: big bottom and chest. This hits right at my hips. It's a little tight across my chest (40 DDD, and I typically wear an XL). But it cinches at my waist and looks very cute with almost anything.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a fashionable but practical “past the hips” raincoat. Something to wear alone or with a sweater or light fleece underneath. I am just over 5’2” and weigh 100 pounds. I ordered X-Small. Looks very flattering and sheds the rain. (Note. I live in Oregon, I haven’t had a chance to try it in a hard rain yet. But when I do. I can update. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT. After reading a lot of reviews on this rain jacket, I ended up going with a small. I'm 5ft 2in. and weighing 106lbs, so it was tough searching for the perfect jacket that was long enough to hit my mid-thigh, but not look like the fabric was overwhelming my frame. I'd say that I'm of average built, so if you have hips, you may want to size up. I can't complain with this purchase. The fit, length, style, and price was what made this jacket worth it. I bought this because I'm moving to Oregon and will be traveling to Ireland.
customer_reviews.author: ORclimber

customer_reviews.title: Great basic rain jacket at great price
customer_reviews.text: For reference I'm 5'2" about 100 lbs and the jacket fits me perfectly. Love the color. Belt is attached so it won't slide off, which I really like, plus it isn't a super long belt. Love the zippered pockets. Length is as shown on model. Wish there were inside pockets, and that the hood came over my head a little more since I usually wear a ponytail, but for the price, I'll take it! Haven't worn it in the rain yet, but I doused the sleeve in water and it rolled off and didn't seep through. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cutieshoes

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait for a rainy day!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a light rain jacket for spring. Well, all the rain we were supposed to get this year turned into snow so I'm not sure how waterproof it is yet, but it's a great light jacket in general. It fits true to size and is really flattering. I like the length of the sleeves. I'm tall and have longer arms than average and this is the perfect length. If you are shorter, it might be long on you.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I got it for a hiking vacation and it was perfect for it
customer_reviews.text: The jacket fits as expected, and does what it is suppose to do: keep you dry under light rain. I got it for a hiking vacation and it was perfect for it. Very light weight, easy to carry around in a backpack without adding weight or volume. My only complaint is that it came completely wrinkled due to be very well packed. After a few days the wrinkles did start to smooth out. This is a rain jacket for warm climates. I does protect you from wind, but do not provide any warm, since it is not lined. The inside is white and unfinished, and may show if you wear it open.
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: This fit me a little loosely in my normal size
customer_reviews.text: This fit me a little loosely, but because I have large hips, almost everything I buy is a little big in the waist and chest. I just tied the tie to fit. It worked like a dream to protect me from Irish mist and Scottish rain for two weeks, and it kept me moderately warm. Glad I spent the extra money to buy Columbia instead of a cheap knock-off.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain_Hunter

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty plain-Jane but will work with jeans or a dress ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'5", 125 lbs, usually order Medium, but I read a lot of reviews that said the jacket runs small, so I ordered a Large instead. Guess What? It's too big! I won't return because I can just cinch the belt down and layer things under it in winter if needed. BUT my advice is to order your usual size. It's pretty plain-Jane but will work with jeans or a dress I think, so all in all I'm happy with it. Haven't tried it in rain yet but it has a huge tag that says "waterproof fabric" so I'm hoping it will be fine. I would order again, just in a Medium.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Runs a teeny bit big. Thr fit is lovely and flattering! I ourchased this for a trip to DC and it was easily packed and unpacked and still looked great.The sleeves are designed where you can close them with velco and make them smaller which was great for keeping my arms dry as we walked around. The tiebelt allows for it to look like you have a waist, which was a real slimming effect. It can be dressed up or down... I got the black color. It isn't lined... So I'm looking forward to wearing it for multiple seasons without being "too warm".
customer_reviews.author: Meow

customer_reviews.title: Cute and perfect
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on in store to know which size I am. I am 5'1 at 130 lbs and am usually a medium. The medium was very tight so order a size up or try it in stores first. Also the inside looks like inside pockets but it is not. There is about an inch or two gap. I going to bring it to a tailor to continue the stitch so I can have inside pockets. Very stylish and exactly what I was looking for. Unfortunately it hasn't rained yet for me to fully try it. If anything is wrong I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: 🌿

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coat. I ordered the Cypress and it is a very pretty color. I am 5'4 and wear size 4-6 with 34DD chest and ordered a Medium. I have long arms and a big chest so a small may have been too short and tight. It fits great and I love the belt and snaps. It is not baggy but there is enough room to layer comfortably. This is a great jacket and if I ever need another one, I will order again.
customer_reviews.author: lucyroux

customer_reviews.title: Slightly too small, color very different than picture.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I own is a Large, so I ordered a large in this. Too small, unless you don't wear anything underneath. The color does not look like the picture at all, but I liked the color even better than the picture. I ordered Cloudburst, instead of it being light blue it was a dark teal. Very pretty. Almost fit me but I couldn't sit down without it feeling too tight. I would have loved to order the XL but it's double the price I paid for the Large.
customer_reviews.author: Deb_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Leaks in Heavy Rain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jacket at the end of September and up until today I was happy with it. I had worn it in moderate rain to and from the car at the office with no issues. However today I walking around the city for less than 10 minutes and when I removed the coat both of my shoulders were visibly wet as well as my left arm. I loved the length and style of the jacket but the run off caused my thighs to be wet. For the price and brand I had at least expected my clothing underneath would stay dry.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M.

customer_reviews.title: Actually really like the color and so far being in Florida the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large because I wanted to be able to wear a sweater under it if I needed to. With that in mind it fits perfectly. Travel a lot and I can fit it in a gallon zip lock for travel. Actually really like the color and so far being in Florida the rain has not gotten through but have not worn in any of our summer deluges yet. Great purchase/great price
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice very light weight shell rain jacket. I read the reviews and I should have listened to them. This is not a jacket for a rainy day in Ohio or Chicago. This is a rain jacket for light rain somewhere warm. Overall, the jacket is very nice! I'm 5'2 105 pounds. I had a hoodie on when trying it on and it wasn't tight but was not loose at all. I will return this as I now live in Chicago and need a warmer thicker rain jacket. I wish the fabric was thicker because then I would have kept it. I don't think this would be of any help when it rains hard.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cute jacket with tricky zipper
customer_reviews.text: Really cute and flattering jacket, but I didn't get the opportunity to check for waterproofness because the zipper was almost impossible to use. I'd have kept it otherwise as it packs down small and looks great for travel or keeping in your purse. If Columbia fixes the issue I'll rebuy this jacket in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Dier

customer_reviews.title: Too tight around bust
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'5, 120 lb 36c/27/35, the small fits great from waist down, but too tight around my chest area. I ordered a small, returning for a medium. Will update review. The jacket itself looks great, very versatile. I can just pack this one jacket on a trip for hiking and going to a nice restaurant for an evening meal.
customer_reviews.author: N.C

customer_reviews.title: It’s so cute and the belt is great to make the coat flatter but
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this coat for about a year and only needed to wear it a few times. It is not waterproof. Each time I’ve worn it I’ve tried to ignore that I am damp and my clothes are wet when I take it off. It’s so cute and the belt is great to make the coat flatter but, unfortunately, it just doesn’t do the one thing it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: KC87

customer_reviews.title: Highly functional hiking jacket.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well-made, highly functional hiking jacket. I expect it's truly waterproof. It has lots of good features (zippered pockets, adjustable hood) and is comfortable and attractive. It does tend to crease and wrinkle rather easily and isn't the sort of fabric that is soft and quiet. One tiny thing that bothered me (but probably wouldn't bother anyone else) is that the inside of the jacket near the neck is white, so when it isn't worn all the way zipped or buttoned up, that white net-like lining shows. For a jacket this sturdy, it's quite light. It would probably last forever even if you wore it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Trenner1

customer_reviews.title: Great Rain Jacket, Snug Fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought size medium. My measurements are 38, 30, 33 and I am 5'5" and 133 pounds. The jacket fits just right with a long-sleeve medium weight t-shirt and jeans. I think a lightweight sweater would work ok, too, but I could not wear anything heavier if I wanted to zip it all the way up. This is exactly how I was hoping it would fit to wear in Virginia in spring and fall when it can be rainy but not too cool. It is a very well made jacket with great rain features - back vent, snaps at the wrists, drawstring hood, and mid-thigh length. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Sardelli

customer_reviews.title: Not a raincoat!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and look of this jacket, it is reasonably comfortable and breathes better than a traditional slicker. However, it’s been about 6 months and already water is coming through the shoulder seams (see attached photos of the coat I had worn UNDER the trench in a cold rain for a walk around the block). Completely soaked through in under 15 minutes. The zipper is also fussy and can be hard to get started, and the hood blows right off in even a light wind. Overall, really disappointing after my previous Columbia raincoat lasted a good 5-6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Walbridge

customer_reviews.title: fit, quality, price and style.
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight rain coat! I really like the breathable fabric as it lets some air in the back of the jacket and cools me down. It is not a coat to buy if you are looking for warmth as there is no lining, however a long sleeve or light sweater underneath would do the trick. I like the way it buttons all the way up to the face to keep the rain from coming inside the hood. The belt gives it structure and fashion so you can wear it without feeling like you are in a poncho. I would recommend this for fit, quality, price and style.
customer_reviews.author: JJFreeds

customer_reviews.title: I really like this jacket
customer_reviews.text: I really like this jacket. It's not crunchy and loud like a lot of rain jackets can be. I have worn it in the rain several times already and it has kept me dry. My only issue is the belt is a little high for me. It looks totally cute, and maybe my torso is a tad long...I'm almost 5'6" 120 lbs and got a small and it fits just great...I could easily wear a thick sweater under it, too. I did get a compliment the first time I wore it "cute rain coat" and lets face it, it's hard to find a cute rain coat!
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Decent fit and water resistance
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2" 32B 115 pounds. XS fit perfectly but the fit could be more flattering. The shade of brown color is also not very appealing. Also not sure how waterproof the jacket is. May just be water resistant. I wore it in Hawaii and got caught in a heavier rainfall, and I felt a bit wet after extended wear but could have been sweat from lack of breathability.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Love this coat!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for rainy days! The waist tie is a nice touch to a traditional raincoat. It makes me look like I actually have a shape, whereas most raincoats do not. It's lightweight and big enough to wear another layer underneath! I plan on taking this jacket to Paris with me when I study abroad next month!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: So I just received this in the mail, I wanted a short black trenchcoat, slightly different from the usual trenchcoat style, that is just what I got😊 I did think the hood could be removed, it can't but no big deal! If you are looking 4 this coat 2 keep you warm,,,,,,it most definitely will not! Very thin material, BUT it is a nice trenchcoat, fits me perfect and I would absolutely recommend it, but if it's chilly outside, you will want 2 layer up! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Helz M,

customer_reviews.title: Really love the style of this raincoat and seems to hold ...
customer_reviews.text: Really love the style of this raincoat and seems to hold up pretty well. Only downside is it seems to leak occasionally, but its hard to tell. Definitely not the best for a down-pour, but help up well to regular drizzle, and the look is very flattering.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed a lightweight jacket to wear while I studied abroad in Spain. It's a cute jacket and it fits perfectly, but it did not keep out the rain even a little bit! One of my friends recognized my jacket and said she had bought the same one a few years ago and hers wasn't waterproof either. Once I got home I sprayed the jacket with an entire container of waterproofing spray and it still didn't repel water. While this is a good lightweight jacket, it is not a good raincoat. You're better off spending some extra money to get a Marmot or North Face coat that will actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Podhajsky

customer_reviews.title: Great and fashionable rain coat!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this rain coat! It is exactly what I wanted. It is water proof so far! It has the look of a trench with a good. I probably could have sized down but from previous reviews I was slightly worried it would run smaller. I feel like it fits true to size. The only complaint I have so far is it is hard to zip but I hope that after time and use it will be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Great rain coat! True to size & color. Amazing deal! I am 5'11" 160lbs & wear a 36d bra. I ordered this coat in an XL and it fits perfectly! Enough room to layer & still looks cute. Haven't worn it in the rain yet so I will update after my vacation to Ireland & England.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: I love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket! It falls below my hips, so I know it will really protect me from the rain. It does not breath well though (which is to be expected because it's waterproof), so I sweat kind of easily if I am anywhere that is somewhat warm when wearing it. I really like the color and I like the belt as well. I have not actually warn it in the rain yet, so I cannot speak to how well it keeps you dry. If it's terrible, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: MEK2009

customer_reviews.title: More than a little small
customer_reviews.text: This jacket was way too small for the size. I normally wear a large but because I wanted to be able to wear a sweater underneath it I ordered an extra large. I tried it on with a light t-shirt and could barely get it zipped or move my arms. Back it went. Really too bad because it was exactly what I wanted.Visually it looked more like a medium.
customer_reviews.author: M. I. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I like the coat but as others stated it does run small. I originally had ordered an XL but it was about an inch away from reaching around my middle. I returned the XL and ordered a 1X in womens. I have recently dropped quite a bit of weight and currently am finding an XL is a tad small but a 1X is too big. I figured this size should work perfectly for me. The 1X barely goes all the way around my middle. I will keep it as I'm still dropping pounds. I recommend ordering at least 1 size larger than you normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: KDS

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this jacket! I purchased it for a recent trip to London. I needed a lightweight jacket that was waterproof because, well, London. I also wanted something that wouldn't scream "tourist." This coat was perfect- large pockets in the inside and out? The hood was great and the drawstrings actually worked. The two way zipper is my favorite feature and the belt gave it that "finished" look. I do wish the belt were removable though. Also, be aware that it is fitted, so if you are planning to wear it with a thick sweater or a sweatshirt it will be tight in the waist.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Twedell

customer_reviews.title: Great rain coat!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality rain jacket. I haven't worn it yet, but I look forward to wearing it. It fits great, I found that it ran a little smaller than I thought it should. I bought an extra large so that I had plenty of room for layers underneath it. Very stylish for a rain coat too.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket, but a bit small
customer_reviews.text: A nice coat, lightweight so it will be easy to pack. I haven't worn it in the rain yet, so can't say whether it is waterproof. A bit smaller than I would have liked in the size that is usually a bit loose on me. I wear Medium to Large in shirts and coats, and this Large is comfortable, but has little room for wearing anything very thick under it.
customer_reviews.author: S. T. Maas

customer_reviews.title: Columbia Trench looks better than it fits.
customer_reviews.text: The look and design is exactly as promoted, but the size is definitely not what it appeared to be from the chart used to order. I like how lightweight the jacket is and that it still holds warmth and dryness close to your skin regardless of the elements. I just am not happy that it was such a tight fit for the size that I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6", 128lbs. I purchased a small and it fits perfectly. I even have room to wear a thick sweater or sweatshirt under it if I want. I can't say enough good things about this jacket. I loved it so much that I purchased one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish chic and totally waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Fits well just smallish. Very good fit. Stylish. Thin but totally waterproof. The belt ties at smallwst part of waist so quite slimming. The color is less green and more neutral in person. Glad i bought it as i was on the fence. Came with tag priced at $100. Cheaper through Amazon so its a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Loki420

customer_reviews.title: Tight around hips
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a large even though I often wear medium. I'm pear-shaped and was worried about my hips. It sorta buttons, but it's not wearable. I need to lose a few before I can wear it properly, but it is cute. Just beware if you're bottom-heavy.
customer_reviews.author: SophisticatedBrowser

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Was Hoping For
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this item, but unfortunately I just didn't. I've been on the hunt for a nice all weather trench looking coat and there are several great ones on the market. This one looked stylish from the pictures but I did not think it was at all in person. It is truly a thin rain coat with very scratchy material and not a universal all weather rain coat I was looking for. This one is going back and I continue to be on the hunt.
customer_reviews.author: LANNE

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's a lovely coat but I think it does have poorer quality because the threads unravel really quickly. But it's what I was looking for a not so typical rain coat but also a functional trench since I live in the PNW. I do love it and I've tested it in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great Coat, Just Not for Me
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this for a trip to London however I found that my size large fit perfectly around the shoulders (even with a heavy sweater on underneath) but my size 14 hips proved too big for the jacket to comfortably zip up (very tight at the hips). I think a slightly more proportionate person will find this to be perfect though, so if you don't struggle with the large on bottom smaller on top issue than you'll be fine!
customer_reviews.author: Alizabear101

customer_reviews.title: Good Raincoat
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Fit as expected and color true to picture. Colombia always has solid clothing, and this is no exception. Been using this during the raining season and it covers enough that I don’t really need an umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Aleakgirl

customer_reviews.title: This jacket in a M fit fine and looks more stylish than the average raincoat
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10", 150 lbs and typically wear a Medium in everything. This jacket in a M fit fine and looks more stylish than the average raincoat. The sleeves were long enough for me, and the belt hit me at my natural waist. My hips are pretty narrow, but I can see how the jacket would be a bit tight in the hips for curvier women, as other reviews mentioned. This jacket is a bit warm for hot, humid summers unless you're just walking from the car to the office, but I plan on getting more wear out of it in the fall and spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect raincoat
customer_reviews.text: I got a larger size than usual since I knew I would wear it over a large sweater or sweatshirt. Works perfectly for the rain and wind! Waterproof, somewhat wind-proof, and very stylish. It may be that I'm short, but it also covers my butt which is a plus if I have to sit outside after it rains. Would definitely buy again, but its so well made I'm not sure I will ever need another!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: making it the perfect fit. I like that the pockets zipper close
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jacket in anticipation for Hurricane Joaquin. This jacket has an inner lining that keeps me warm while staying fairly light. The hood has a drawstring, making it the perfect fit. I like that the pockets zipper close. I normally wear between an XS and a S, I bought a Small to have room for a sweater underneath if needed. The belt helps the jacket look neat. I would say that I get a little hot in it at times, but humidity is high where I live and I ride my bike everywhere. I'm sure once winter rolls around, I'll be happy it keeps me warm. Overall this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nicolepatts

customer_reviews.title: It really is adorable but if you are full in the hip area ...
customer_reviews.text: It really is adorable but if you are full in the hip area like I am definitely go up a size. I am 150lbs, 5’4, 36 D and I got a medium but I’m sending it back for a L. It fits everywhere else great except for hips
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of my most practical and positive purchases on Amazon. I love this raincoat. It's fits as expected, it doesn't wrinkle, and it's easy to clean. It's very lightweight so if you get cold easily, wear something under. I love that you can tie it with the belt because it gives you a very flattering look. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nemesis

customer_reviews.title: I love this rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this rain jacket. I am 5'11/145lbs and a small fits perfectly. The sleeves are just long enough, but I have really long arms. The slim fit with a belt makes it a much more stylish rain coat. I've used it twice in heavy rain and it works great. I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Laws

customer_reviews.title: A little tight on the booty, but great otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this rain coat. My only complaint is that the bottom is a little tight around my booty (I have a big booty though). I got the large and sleeves are long as well. I probably could’ve gone with the medium had the bottom not been so tight on my booty. Either way though, it’s a great coat!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H

customer_reviews.title: No lining-expect more for the price
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine, I loved the style but there was no lining leaving seams exposed. I found something comparable at Costco with a liner that was much nicer overall for a better price. This jacket could be a 5 star if it was lined.
customer_reviews.author: IA

customer_reviews.title: Nice but defective sizing; these run at least a full size small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5'5", 115# wife in her usual size, S. (She takes an XS in some things.) She was unable to get it on over a sweatshirt, and it was tight over a t-shirt. It looked nice and well-made otherwise, but sizing is clearly defective so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Geezerjock65

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the quality of this jacket. From reading the reviews, I expected the fabric to be much more substantial. Fabric reminds me of a paper tablecloth. If you need a very lightweight jacket that folds into a small pouch for a bag, this would be perfect. If you are looking for a substantial rain jacket, this isn't it. I ordered the black, thinking I would have a classic black rain jacket. Will definitely be returning. I'm a very frequent Amazon shopper and this is my first return.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Ruth

customer_reviews.title: This jacket fit well, especially with layers underneath and ...
customer_reviews.text: This jacket fit well, especially with layers underneath and the belt adds a feminine touch. I sprayed it with waterproofer before wearing and have to encounter much more than drizzles in it.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen L.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Well made, perfect on its own or with layers. I'm petite, but the length was fine for me. I did have the sleeve length altered. One thing I like is that when I cinch up the waist with the belt, the coat still drapes well. (On another coat I ordered, the fabric was nice, but so bulky it would flare out below the waist when the belt was tightened.) Also, the pockets are nice as is the overall quality. Finally, it is easy to wear while driving. I have not tested it in heavy rain, but I've enjoyed wearing it so far in light rain and chilly weather. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: hana

customer_reviews.title: Great shell trench
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted and expected. It is light, but shields you from the rain and cold. There is also room for a sweater underneath because I bought a Large, and it still gives you a nice figure because the belt ties around your waist and looks very nice. The only negative so far is that it is a little small around the shoulders, and also the sleeves are a little short. But I am quite tall (6' 1"), so I expected that, which is why I didn't rate this any lower. Very nice rain jacket - exactly what I need to travel as it is versatile and classy.
customer_reviews.author: EthelBob

customer_reviews.title: A must have. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’ flat, 140 lbs & I winded up ordering a small after reading other reviews on this jacket. It fits perfectly. I see what people mean about it being snug around the hips area, but it actually looked flattering. I went with the color black so it matches every outfit and occasion. Material is strong and not flimsy. Wish it had inside pockets, but otherwise it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight hooded jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Great so far for the fall, which lasted about a week in Buffalo, NY. I needed something lightweight for the cooler mornings but not too heavy by the afternoon. It’s lightweight has been good in the rain. I will wear this until Mother Nature tells me otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Form-fitting, light rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: Form-fitting, light rain jacket. I am approximately 5’9” and 130 lbs and a size small fit perfectly. If I wear a think layer underneath, it is snug, but I prefer a form-fitting rain jacket. Wonderful material, and large hood that you can tighten if the wind is strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley McBride

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight Raincoat
customer_reviews.text: I love my raincoat! I usually wear medium, but went with a large so I can wear a lightweight jacket or sweater underneath. It fits perfectly, the sleeves are not too long, it looks good and the hood has a little extra "visor" in front to keep water from your face. It does not keep you warm though, so you need another jacket underneath. Would not be a good choice for cold weather, this is definitely perfect for a SoCal rain!
customer_reviews.author: c moreno

customer_reviews.title: I returned it as I did not like the look or feel of the unfinished seams or ...
customer_reviews.text: The jacket was described as being lined, both body and sleeves, but it is not lined. I returned it as I did not like the look or feel of the unfinished seams or rubbery coating of the inside.
customer_reviews.author: NC Grandma

customer_reviews.title: I cannot wait to wear this cute trench coat! My favourite purchase so far. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought an XL to wear over a cardigan. I live in Florida and the rainy season is soon coming. I love the colour! (Nocturnal) It's a slate blue.
customer_reviews.author: karen crowley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Coat
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, but the color was a bit "gray"-er than I wanted. On the picture it seemed more beige - exchanging for a dif color.
customer_reviews.author: Darya Quattrocchi

product_meta.title: Columbia Women's
product_meta.description:
There are times when you simply don’t need a thick winter coat. However, when a thin wind-breaker or rain jacket won’t do the job either, Columbia offers a perfect women’s parka that keeps you warm, dry, and comfortable. This rain jacket is that perfect in-between coat to wear when it’s rainy, but not too cold. This comfortable women’s parka has been designed with a back-venting system that helps to improve breathability. It also features a water-resistant outer shell for added protection against the elements. Whether it’s raining, sprinkling, or even snowing, this jacket will keep you warm and dry – regardless of the weather.

Columbia has infused a lot of advanced technology materials in the construction of this ladies’ all-weather parka. The outer shell is made from 100% nylon, the lining core is 100% polyester, and the sleeves are 100% nylon 210T taffeta. Professionally sewn, this advanced technology works together to keep you comfortable and dry. Columbia has also added a few extra features that improve comfort, such as zippered hand pockets, an adjustable belt, cuff tabs, and a weather-resistant hood. The superior materials that make up this women’s winter parka are both water and stain repellent. The jacket is machine washable for easy cleaning when you need it.

This winter jacket is made with a modern classic fit, which is a universal easy fit for a comfortable range of motion. The built-in adjustable belt tightens securely for a precise fit. To ensure the perfect fit, follow these steps for measuring and refer to the size chart. To determine the neck size, measure at the base or thickest part of your neck. For the sleeves, start at the center back of your neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the wrist. Round up to the next even number. For the chest, measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.
feature_bullets: OMNI-SHIELD: Go ahead, try and get dirty. Omni-Shield helps you stay clean and dry by resisting the absorption of liquids. Unlike most fabrics that absorb moisture, Omni-Shield repels moisture and dries quickly—avoiding stains and keeping you clean.
